The present premises are located at Brickland Road in [Tengah](/wiki/Tengah), [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). ## Overview **Hai Inn Temple** was founded in 1928 and is one of the oldest Buddhist temples in Singapore. Regular activities include dharma classes and monthly chanting sessions. The temple has one of the biggest bells of its kind in Singapore, weighing 7 tonnes, with a height of 2.75 metres and 1.7 metres wide. - [Buddhism in Singapore](/wiki/Buddhism_in_Singapore) 1°22′34″N 103°44′04″E﻿ / ﻿1.37607°N 103.73442°E﻿ / 1.37607; 103.73442 This article about a [Buddhist](/wiki/Buddhist) place of worship is a stub.
